TopicTitle: I keep trying to install FusTek Station Parts but it freezes up on loading

Articles.Content:
Just like the title says, I have repeatedly attempted to install the FusTek station parts mod (and its dependencies) but it freezes my KSP on loading. I really want to use this mod with PorkJet's habitat pack (which I found happens to work with 0.25) but I just can't seem to install it.

Please excuse me for the short post. I don't think there is any more to say.

Try the experimental builds on the GitHub repo, which was built for KSP 0.25:

https://github.com/sumghai/FusTek_StationParts
Wait a minute... I installed the new version but it still doesn't work.

Wait a minute... I installed the new version but it still doesn't work.

You stated that installing FusTek causes your game to freeze on loading. Could you provide a screenshot?

Also, in case there's an incompatibility with another add-on, download a second copy of KSP and install only FusTek (and its dependencies) into that copy.

Alright. Here's a screenshot:

I think this is what you want but I'm not sure.

Alright. Here's a screenshot:

http://i.imgur.com/eRL4BMn.png

I think this is what you want but I'm not sure.

Looks like the game froze because it's having a problem loading an official KSP part texture.

Try the following:

- Set up a separate installation of KSP with nothing but SQUAD and NASAmission parts (aka a "stock" game), and verify that the game runs correctly

- Install only FusTek, but not its dependencies, and verify that the game runs correctly

- Install each of FusTek's dependencies, and again verify that the game runs correctly each time

The results of these tests will determine where we go from here.

It's probably a part trying to load a resource that doesn't exist. That's usually what makes loading die. However, only a log will say for sure, and note that the text displayed may not have a relation to what it's *actually* dying on.

Looks like the game froze because it's having a problem loading an official KSP part texture.

Try the following:

- Set up a separate installation of KSP with nothing but SQUAD and NASAmission parts (aka a "stock" game), and verify that the game runs correctly

- Install only FusTek, but not its dependencies, and verify that the game runs correctly

- Install each of FusTek's dependencies, and again verify that the game runs correctly each time

The results of these tests will determine where we go from here.

Trying that right now...
@ SpaceLaunchSystem are you renaming any files and if you could can you post a picture of you KSP/GameData/ folder so can see if the mods folders are right ?
Please wait for it to hang, force quit (alt-F4 if on PC), and follow the instructions here for posting the log.
